context_bundle.summary: Go concurrency patterns with goroutines, channels, select statements, sync primitives, and concurrent design patterns for scalable applications

onboarding.quick_start: go run main.go && go run -race main.go
common_patterns: Goroutine: 'go func() { fmt.Println("concurrent") }()' for concurrent execution
Channels: 'ch := make(chan int, 10); ch <- 42; value := <-ch' for communication
Select: 'select { case msg := <-ch1: process(msg); case <-time.After(time.Second): timeout(); }'
WaitGroup: 'var wg sync.WaitGroup; wg.Add(1); go func() { defer wg.Done(); work() }(); wg.Wait()'
Mutex: 'var mu sync.Mutex; mu.Lock(); defer mu.Unlock(); criticalSection()'
Once: 'var once sync.Once; once.Do(func() { initialize() })' for one-time initialization
Worker pool: 'for i := 0; i < workers; i++ { go worker(jobs, results) }'
Context cancellation: 'ctx, cancel := context.WithCancel(ctx); defer cancel(); select { case <-ctx.Done(): return ctx.Err() }'
known_errors: fatal error: all goroutines are asleep - deadlock: Check for channel operations without receivers/senders
race condition detected: Use 'go run -race', add proper synchronization with mutex or channels
send on closed channel: Check channel state before sending, use sync.Once for close
goroutine leak: Ensure goroutines can exit, use context for cancellation
blocking select: Add default case 'default: // non-blocking' or timeout case
channel buffer full: Increase buffer size or add more consumers
